page.title: 08EDUCATION - HEDINGHAM
page.content: The largest building in the area is the Sible Hedingham Comprehensive school, for pupils of 11-18yrs. A variety of subjects is taught (eg. computer studies, foreign languages). The number of pupils at the school is approx. 1500. There are 65 teachers employed. The primary schools feeding the comprehensive are Sible, Castle, Ridgewell, Gt. Maplestead, Gosfield, Gt. Yeldham, Toppesfield, Colne Engaine and Pebmarsh. The only primary school within the area is Castle Hedingham with 143 pupils ranging from just under 5yrs. to 11yrs. There are 5 teachers in the school with one relief teacher who works one and a half days per week to allow the teaching Head to deal with administrative duties. Three Playgroups exist which help prepare the young children for school.
